intro: Isoetes × amesii, commonly known as the Ames' water horsetail, is a hybrid plant in the genus Isoetes, which belongs to the family Equisetaceae. It is characterized by its spore-bearing structures called strobils, which are typically found at the apex of the plant. The plant is native to parts of North America and is often found in wetland environments. Its morphology includes a central axis with whorls of leaves, and it exhibits a unique form of vascular tissue. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable species for ecological and botanical study.
